docs.snippet: LISBON, Oct. 29 -- Of the 122 persons -- passengers and crew -- who were on the Anchor Line Steamer Roumania, wrecked Thursday night on the Portuguese coast, only seven survive. These are Capt. George Hamilton of the British Indian Army, Lieut. Ro...
docs.lead_paragraph: LISBON, Oct. 29 -- Of the 122 persons -- passengers and crew -- who were on the Anchor Line Steamer Roumania, wrecked Thursday night on the Portuguese coast, only seven survive. These are Capt. George Hamilton of the British Indian Army, Lieut. Roohe, and seven Lascars.

headline.main: THE WRECKED ROUMANIA; ONLY TWO OF THE FIFTY-FIVE PASSSENGERS WERE SAVED. CAPT. HAMILTON, LIEUT. ROCHE, AND SEVEN SAILORS THE ONLY SURVIV- ORS -- SOME OF THE LOST PEOPLE -- THE SHORE STREWN WITH WRECKAGE -- CAPTAIN LOST RECKONING.

docs.snippet: LOON LAKE, N. Y., Sept. 7. -- Another rainy day kept President Harrison pretty closely confined to his cottage, although after breakfast this morning he drove over to the station with W. H. Phillips, who brought over the mail to the hotel....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOON LAKE, N. Y., Sept. 7. -- Another rainy day kept President Harrison pretty closely confined to his cottage, although after breakfast this morning he drove over to the station with W. H. Phillips, who brought over the mail to the hotel.

headline.main: SQUALLY AT LOON LAKE.; SO THE PRESIDENT BROUGHT UP HIS CORRESPONDENCE -- A PARDON.

docs.snippet: It is expected that the Iron steamboat Cepheus, which was beached last Friday night 100 feet off the shore at Norton's Point, Coney Island, will he raised early this morning, unless a storm or an accident of some kind intervenes. Eight pumps were ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is expected that the Iron steamboat Cepheus, which was beached last Friday night 100 feet off the shore at Norton's Point, Coney Island, will he raised early this morning, unless a storm or an accident of some kind intervenes. Eight pumps were placed on the deck of the vessel Sunday and yesterday a ninth pump was put in place.

headline.main: PUMPING OUT THE GEPHEUS.; TO BE REPAIRED IN TIME FOR HER TRIP NEXT SUNDAY.
RUN DOWN BY THE SAALE.; A BARK SUNK, BUT THE CREW RESCUED.

headline.main: SEVENTEEN LIVES LOST.; FATALITIES ON THE LEATHERS GREATER THAN AT FIRST REPORTED.

docs.snippet: LITTLE HARBOR, N.S., Oct. 13. -- The wreck of the bark Melmerby, which took place off here last night, was one of the most heart-rending affairs that has ever occurred off the Nova Scotia coast. The only survivors are the pilot, who took the bark ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LITTLE HARBOR, N.S., Oct. 13. -- The wreck of the bark Melmerby, which took place off here last night, was one of the most heart-rending affairs that has ever occurred off the Nova Scotia coast. The only survivors are the pilot, who took the bark down the Gulf of St. Lawrence from Quebec, and two sailors who swam ashore.

headline.main: TWELVE LIVES AT LEAST LOST.; THE BARK MELMERBY WRECKED NEAR LITTLE HARBOR, N.S.

docs.snippet: NEW-ORLEANS, Dec. 26.--To-day United States Local Inspectors of Steam Vessels O'Reilly and Youngblood submitted their final report upon the collision in the river of the steamship Andean and the tugboat Charlie Wood....
docs.abstract: Andean-Charlie Wood Collision; United States Inspectors' Report
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW-ORLEANS, Dec. 26.--To-day United States Local Inspectors of Steam Vessels O'Reilly and Youngblood submitted their final report upon the collision in the river of the steamship Andean and the tugboat Charlie Wood.

docs.snippet: Chief Officer Cusick and thirteen of the crew of the steamship Edith Godden, which foundered off the Jamaica coast on Nov. 20, arrived here yesterday on the steamship Atalanta from St. Ann's Bay. The Godden sailed from Montego Bay for this port at...
docs.lead_paragraph: Chief Officer Cusick and thirteen of the crew of the steamship Edith Godden, which foundered off the Jamaica coast on Nov. 20, arrived here yesterday on the steamship Atalanta from St. Ann's Bay. The Godden sailed from Montego Bay for this port at 5 P.M. on Nov. 20.

headline.main: RESCUED SAILORS ARRIVE.; THE STEAMSHIP ATALANTA BRINGS PART OF THE EDITH GODDEN'S CREW.
